item.description: It's an old carving knife. The long dulled blade sports a surprising number of dents.
item.name: Kitchen Knife
item.short_description: A rusty carving knife

item.description: A lightweight weapon that is built for speed. A favorite of assassins!
item.name: Dirk
item.short_description: A small dirk

item.description: This dirk sports a menacing extra notch at its end. Monsters are sure to run screaming from this horror!
item.name: Curved Dirk
item.short_description: A dirk with a spike

item.description: The throwing dagger is a well balanced weapon, favored by the feared assassin-poets of the Order of the Grizzled Pony.
item.name: Throwing Dagger
item.short_description: A well-balanced throwing dagger.

item.description: Many-a-throats were silenced by this here black iron
item.name: Dagger
item.short_description: A curiously shaped dagger

item.description: The extra-long serrated edge of this hunting knife is enough to induce nightmares. A nicely carved wooden handle completes this menacing weapon.
item.name: Hunting Knife
item.short_description: A hunting knife with a serrated edge.

item.description: This knife bears the symbol of Unamoin. The god is enthroned on a seat of flame, before him stand a long line of souls, to be sacrificed for the divine feast.
item.name: Ceremonial Dagger
item.short_description: A wide-bladed ceremonial dagger.

item.description: A dwarven shortsword of average workmanship
item.name: Short sword
item.short_description: A stubby short sword

item.description: Longer and wider than a shortsword, the dwarven military brand is sometimes held with two hands. It is designed for close-quarter underground melee fighting.
item.name: Dwarven sword
item.short_description: A sword of dwarven make.

item.description: Officer in the royal guard wear this pointed swords as a sign of rank. They're usually not used in actual combat but are only carried during a ceremony.
item.name: Ornamental officer sword
item.short_description: A strange pointed sword.

item.description: A bastard sword can be wielded either by one or both hands... (If you still have both hands)
item.name: Bastard sword
item.short_description: The rusty bastard sword has seen plenty of use

item.description: The longsword is the noble weapon of the knights
item.name: Long sword
item.short_description: A well-balanced, shiny longsword

item.description: The blade of this sword is made from laying many strips of metal upon each other in a twisted 'snake' formation. This gives the weapon its exceptional strength.
item.name: Twisted sword
item.short_description: A blade with a snake-like form

item.description: Adopted from an invading force of Southern pirates, these heavy cutlasses can deliver a crushing blow.
item.name: Royal Cutlass
item.short_description: A cutlass with a curved, heavy blade

item.description: A smaller version of the royal cutlass that can be held in one hand.
item.name: Nederianese Cutlass
item.short_description: A small cutlass

item.description: These swords were designed to be used from horseback. As such they tend to be top-heavy and awkward to use in melee.
item.name: Cavalry Sabre
item.short_description: A strangely-balanced utilitarian sword

item.description: Mostly used by the aristocracy, these weapons were designed to puncture armor rather to strike with the edge. They require extreme finesse when used and are more likely to break.
item.name: Rapier
item.short_description: A long pointed sword with not much of an edge.

item.description: Only persons of exceeding strength can cleave their enemies to bits with this greatsword
item.name: Great sword
item.short_description: A two-handed greatsword

item.description: Wrought by the elvish metal smiths of Allovium, this blade is specially prepared to slay dragons.
item.name: Purple Worm Slayer
item.short_description: A purple curved sword

item.description: This graceful, single-edged sword cannot be left out of any rpg!
item.name: Katana
item.short_description: A single-edge sword of mythic proportions!

item.description: The fabled weapon of Goliompur was forged by elven smiths in the deep forests of Alovium eons ago. It is rumored to speak to those it chooses to be her leader.
item.name: Goliompur
item.short_description: A weapon of exceeding craftsmanship. It is marked with strange runes.

item.description: Legend tells of how king Haomen of the Nordic men hew his enemies in the battles at the fjords of Gormoth wielding this blade.
item.name: Dextran
item.short_description: You feel a crispness in the air and smell oaken notes while near this weapon.

item.description: A battleaxe forged under the mountain in darkness and silence
item.name: Battleaxe
item.short_description: The sturdy battleaxe also serves as a walking stick

item.description: Weapon of the feared dwarven assassins, the throwing axe returns to its owner after its arc of death!
item.name: Throwing axe
item.short_description: A short-handled throwing axe

item.description: The Gorlish scouts of the Underlake clans carry these axes. The scouts are able to scale the sheerest rock faces of their underground realm, so the axes are used as weapons as well as climbing gear.
item.name: Gorlish Axe
item.short_description: A hooked medium axe

item.description: This giant, two-handed axe is the rough weapon of the wandering executioner.
item.name: Greataxe
item.short_description: A crudely-made two-handed axe

item.description: This weapon is obviously the work of an orc or ogre smith. It's handle is too wide for most human hands.
item.name: Chomper
item.short_description: A large axe with a serrated blade

item.description: This is the very weapon which, wielded by Thuzgorod the Red slew the goblin king in the dwarven wars of Uzmagil.
item.name: Persuader
item.short_description: A stout axe with strange runes

item.description: This is the Golden Axe once held by the many arms of Thulionix the dwarven god of suffering.
item.name: Golden Axe
item.short_description: A small axe of pale gold color

item.description: This small gnomish bow is made of a light gray wood
item.name: Smallbow
item.short_description: A small bow

item.description: This bow is made of a strong wood with artistic carvings on its handles
item.name: Ornatebow
item.short_description: A nicely crafted, strong bow

item.description: While cumbersome to reload, the crossbow delivers an armor-piercing greeting to any foe.
item.name: Crossbow
item.short_description: A large crossbow

item.description: Though faster to reload than its pumped-up cousin, this crossbow has a shorter range and delivers less power.
item.name: Light crossbow
item.short_description: A crossbow with an orange wood handle

item.description: This large bow is the most common weapon of Sylvian rangers
item.name: Longbow
item.short_description: A long bow adorned with a leaf symbol

item.description: The elven armies under Mondiuvelen the Hale once carried these large bows
item.name: Strongbow
item.short_description: A large bow with an ivory sight-piece

item.description: The Sylvian bow of Bolinfupur kills silently. It is made from a single piece of blood stone.
item.name: Bolinfupur
item.short_description: This bow is made from a dull grayish-red substance that resembles stone

item.description: This roughly hewn tree-limb barely qualifies as a primitive weapon. The handle is worn by years of head-bashing.
item.name: Wooden club
item.short_description: Your basic, non-enchanted, non-spiked wooden club.

item.description: The clerical weapon of choice! Dispense holy bashing of heads and denting of armor with this divine instrument of bludgeoning.
item.name: Rounded mace
item.short_description: A metal-headed mace with a plain wooden handle.

item.description: The main advantage when using a morning star over its bestudded brother the Spiked Flail, is that the user need not bother with the weapon's business end getting stuck in the target.
item.name: Morning Star
item.short_description: A metal ball on a chain

item.description: Favorite backup weapon of the knight. Should your sword be lost or irretrievable lodged in an opponent, reach for the flail and wade in the gore with a smile.
item.name: Spiked flail
item.short_description: Spiked ball dangles at the end of a chain of impressive length.

item.description: Once used by the dead-eater ogre legions of the Crimson Leaf as a weapon for crowd control. This mace is to be held by two large hands.
item.name: Double-fisted Maragon
item.short_description: An enormous two-handed mace.

item.description: Created quite by accident, this black flail was the side-effect of a failed experiment at the school of war-wizardry.
item.name: Darkflail
item.short_description: The black flail emits a humming noise.

item.description: Descendant of Glauis the legendary talking mace of Horom, this agile weapon is also a ferocious combatant.
item.name: Warmaster
item.short_description: This mace is surrounded by a near-visible aura of blood-lust.

item.description: This long wooden pole serves both as a walking stick and fighting staff.
item.name: Quarter Staff
item.short_description: A long wood pole.

item.description: A mid-range weapon of precision and finesse, the javelin grew in popularity as a court hunting weapon under Haladil.
item.name: Javelin
item.short_description: A finely crafted, lightweight lance.

item.description: Forged in the ice-caverns of the ancient troll halls of Gormoril (not a masterpiece of precision) this iron lance is made for a large fighter.
item.name: Longspear
item.short_description: A rough iron pole with a sharpened tip.

item.description: An ancient long reaching weapon of a gladiatorial history. This trident bears the symbol of the sea-lords of Urtap.
item.name: Trident
item.short_description: A long metal pole with three barbed prongs.

item.description: This weapon was once held by the royal guard of the late king Haladil.
item.name: Halberd
item.short_description: A long pole with an axe blade at its top.

item.description: A reaping scythe strengthened and sharpened for more than just crops.
item.name: War-scythe
item.short_description: A wicked curved blade atop a simple wooden pole.

item.description: The dryad lich Milmoril needs no introduction. This long black scythe with the saw-blade and bone handle was her choice weapon.
item.name: Scythe of Milmoril
item.short_description: A large black scythe of excellent (if evil) workmanship.

item.description: The legend of the dead king Iconoclastus, powers the sword against creatures who cast spells. The late king's hatred of all things magical was well known.
item.name: Brand of Iconoclast
item.short_description: This bastard sword seems to glow with an unhealthy shine.
